website_summaries.verdict: While we didn't like their sound as much as the Audioengine 2s', the Audyssey Media Speakers are an attractively designed set of powered multimedia speakers that offer good sound and the added bonus of a digital optical input.
pros: The Audyssey Media Speakers have an attractive, compact design, and offer good sound with lots of bass
They're also one of the few powered stereo speakers to have an optical digital connection (for Apple TV or the PS3, for instance) in addition to an analog input
cons: The speakers don't play terribly loud and they overemphasize detail
There's no remote, and no way to toggle between inputs

customer_reviews.title: A great sounding speaker without a subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: These are amplified speakers and do require AC power. However, they produce exceptional bass response without the need for a third box (subwoofer) and more cabling connections. I really like the rigid stands, which I used to mount these speakers upside down and under a shelf above my desktop monitor. I routed the rear edge of the shelf to run the speaker wire, power cable and mini-plug cord to avoid having visible wires. If you don't want to have the speaker transformer always online, it's quite simple to disconnect the AC cord at the transformer to avoid having the speakers remain on standby.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy that's pleasing to the eye.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these speakers over 2 years now and the only that bothers me sometimes is the how "quickly" they turn off. It's not that quick but sometimes you pause your music and forget to start it back up and then when you remember you have to turn them back on. Not a big deal but a minor annoyance. Love everything else about these speakers. I'd probably get the bluetooth version now but for what they are, they're good quality. Good highs, mids, and lows. Fills a room with sound better than I've experienced with other 2 speaker systems.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: not just for your computer
customer_reviews.text: Don't just think of these as speakers for your computer. They provide enough volume to use in a small living room. Bass sounds like bass from much larger enclosures. Only slight negative is that volume control is a manual knob on one of the speakers. But once you set it, you won't have to adjust it that often anyway.
customer_reviews.author: boston403

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers hindered by an annoying feature.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these speakers a couple of months ago. They're still working well and the sound quality is great. They have really good bass quality for such little speakers. I would probably have given 5 stars if it weren't for the auto-off feature. This feature is so frustrating that i'm considering selling these for another modal. You can decide for yourself if this feature would annoy you or not, if you don't think it would bother you, then these are great speakers for the price otherwise, I would definitely look for different speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Alastair

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for a week now, all I can say is awesome speakers. I compared these to the Bo_e Monitors and decided on these. very happy with the full sound with nice base but not overpowering. They are larger than the Monitors but still can be packed in a checked bag for trips.
customer_reviews.author: Poppa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, great value!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased these speakers [12/2012] and I couldn't be happier. High frequencies are crisp and clean, there is no shortcoming in the mid-range, and the bass is surprisingly rich...perfect for my application [PC speakers in a medium sized room]. I was nervous about the lack of bass/treble control, but Audyssey has these tuned PERFECTLY (In my experience most 2.0 speakers seem to be bass and treble dominant, but not these babies). They are replacing a set of Logitech 2.1 speakers I previously used and have surpassed those by leaps and bounds. I have only tried them with 1/8" input, so I'm very excited to try them with SPDIF and realize their full potential!
customer_reviews.author: JLssg4

customer_reviews.title: So close to being a really great product; the auto off keeps the product from ...
customer_reviews.text: The only feature keeping this product from 5 stars is the auto-off feature that can't be disabled. So close to being a really great product; the auto off keeps the product from being practical in applications other than as a computer desktop speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. H

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers!! Shakes my desk when gaming.  Thought it was thunder outside the first time!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny ! Really lets you hear music and game sounds like it's live. Installed and used first tme with Diablo 3 played for a couple of months, after install sounded so different i thought maybe it was from a patch but just speakers making a huge difference. Really like a lot. Fan of the Powered speakers big time.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ed P. Leboeuf

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is quite good, though I'm not pleased with the power-saving shut ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is quite good, though I'm not pleased with the power-saving shut off after only 5 or 10 minutes - that's just too quick. I had to write a program to loop with a sleep timer and play a sound every 3 minutes to keep the power on. Also the power cable connection is very bad, the cable falls out constantly if you even breathe near it... happens ALL the time. The volume levels are so low that I have to turn my device volume incredibly high compared to other speakers to get much out of them. Strange. That said, they still sound nice.
customer_reviews.author: Technology Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and sounds great for the size and price. Easy setup nice mix of inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: turned my pc into home theater. they are very good looking, wish i would have got them long long ago
customer_reviews.author: Nelville V. Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Small and fine
customer_reviews.text: Impressive and expansive sound. Transparent sound stage. Gets better as you move away. Light on the midrange big on bass and treble. Not audiophile quality but big sound for the size. Fine computer speakers for around $200.
customer_reviews.author: Justbop

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers...poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: I found these speakers to sound great, but thought the documentation was lacking in how to put it together and work.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Wechter

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound at first, failing after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these based off a "best of" article for PC Speakers when doing a Google search. There were a few bad reviews for some issues but it seemed to be a small percentage of people. Seems we're in that small percent. The volume knob is also the power button. You have to press it in to turn it on. The soldering job or something doesn't seem to be the best cause now 3 months after purchase if the volume knob tilts slightly upward the volume goes instantly loud. Making it annoying to adjust the knob at all. Going to have to ask for a replacement or something.
customer_reviews.author: Stur

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound for multi-media, not quite great for music.
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the speaker is great. nicely touched matt body looks really pretty and cool. Sound is the matter on speaker. It's surround is giving well balanced and wide sound stage. high range and vocal is very clear and straight forward. it will be great choice for who want to watch bunch of movies and play games. It's passive bass radiator in its back side of unit generates really deep and great bass. however, it's v-shaped frequency setup makes user feels kinda not enough in lower mid-range frequency, which means not quite balanced for all range, I can't suggest this for listening music.
customer_reviews.author: Chanyoon Park

customer_reviews.title: Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Very nice to look at, and has a great sound quality. The fact that there are many wires and it isn't bluetooth is what bothers me.
customer_reviews.author: Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: The Audyssey Lower East Side speakers are great, no These speakers rock all the way to 11 ! Get them, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Lower East Side Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound amazing! Audiophiles will be satisfied with Audyssey's expertise in audio. They are extremely clear, especially through the optical audio port. Don't expect glass breaking bass, however it is definitely present and much more tight than other systems. The passive bass radiators do this well as opposed to a dedicated sub. However, they are expensive and lack a few features I would like to see (ex. wake up from standby). This is the only reason these did not get full stars.
customer_reviews.author: SeanO

customer_reviews.title: These do not last
customer_reviews.text: These produced pretty good sound for their size, especially without a sub. Too bad they don't last very long (mine lasted slightly more than a year) and their quality is questionable with refurbs that pop up on Woot. I would avoid these.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great set of speakers.
customer_reviews.text: i won't say they are the most accurate speakers out there, but they sure know how to put a joy on a song,
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to try these speakers when they arrived today. Turned on iTunes. Plugged them in first using a standard audio jack and pushed the volume button to turn on the speakers. The light remained red. Tried again, they turned green for a second and went back to red. No sound except for a short burst of static. My old speakers were working fine this afternoon. Switched to the SPDIF cable and got the same no response. Checked everything multiple times and no positive response so boxed them off and am shipping back to Amazon. Will try the A2s or M-Audio next.
customer_reviews.author: DRew

customer_reviews.title: Faulty unit, no Audyssey response
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the LES Media Speakers through Amazon, delivered on 2/14/12, and it did not work right out of the box. Called Tech Support(east coast); they deduced that I got a bad unit,then said someone would call me from Customer Support(west coast) in a couple hours. It's been a couple days, no word from anyone. Tried to get to someone in Customer Support/Sales at HQ in CA, to no avail. I LOVE my Audyssey iPhone South of Market Audio Dock unit (purchased at an Apple store), surprised by this experience.... If no response occurs, will return and go another direction, I guess...
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Heavy & Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and cheaply made. The sound was inconsistent and one speaker was louder than the other. I just returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Castro-Frenzel

customer_reviews.title: and after a brief breakin time they sound wonderful. fill her smallish bedroom with loud
customer_reviews.text: gave these to my daughter who enjoys spotify prem. and after a brief breakin time they sound wonderful. fill her smallish bedroom with loud,clean,dynamic full-range sound. and i mean full range from deep-bass (50-ish Hz or so) to twinkling highs. clean sound w no harshness. I can tell you with her door closed if she's crankin it her music can be FELT 2-rms away.! we got a great deal from amazon and went for it about 16 months ago. Would buy them again in a heartbeat if neeeded.IMO these blow away the bose, and frankly any other 2-speaker setup. No sub needed! enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Z.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding desktop speakers
customer_reviews.text: While they aren't life-changingly good like some people seem to proclaim (you'll have to hear a pair of Wilson Alexandrias for that experience) these are awesome desktop speakers; they're truly worlds better than the typical Logitech, Klipsh, Altec Lansing, and other small sets out there. For $200 you get great build quality, nice looks, and solid sound. They won't be mistaken for full-size floor speakers, but you'd be hard pressed to find a better value in a small package. They look nice and they sound nice-- that's pretty much all you can ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Franzen

customer_reviews.title: bought them and was in disbelief at how good the little guys sounded
customer_reviews.text: Stumbled on these gems somehow.... bought them and was in disbelief at how good the little guys sounded. By using the optical input, there is virtually no added noise or distortion at ALL. No, these aren't 10" woofers, but for the size they blow away anything I have ever heard. If you find a set still, grab them and be amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Gorgehiker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small speaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers, plugged them into my puter and was really pleased with the sound, especially considering the small size of the speakers. There is an auto shut-off feature that made them unsuitable for my use, so I returned them. For those with limited desk space and no need for an 'always on' set of speakers, give these little ones consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Norm de Plume

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers in a small package.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are not very big but have very good sound. They have optical and stereo out ports which is nice, you can use either one. Also, the manufacturers must have modified these speakers after people complained of automatic shutoff after 30 minutes because mine don't do that. Anyone who didn't want to buy for that reason should have no concerns buying this speakers because mine do not auto shut off after the 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers for the price. I will end up buying 2 sets. the 30 minutes where users complain about them turning off yea it happens but almost never notice, well it not a deal breaker for me. it almost never happens to me.
customer_reviews.author: El Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be great but no auto-wake from auto-shut off
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, great looking, but there is an auto-sleep "feature" to save power that requires a physical button push to wake up. Not a deal-killer, but not good product design and pretty annoying at this price point. Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Audyssey Speaker Set
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speakers, loud and clear sound. These speakers are great for music, they are even better for movies and TV. My kids also love them to use on their I pads. Best choice for our family. I recommended it to all my friends. Love it! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Its like hearing for the first time.
customer_reviews.text: A pleasure to listen to. The sounds are crisp and smooth. Clarity is very sweet like a river of melted chocolate. These speakers are such a treat!
customer_reviews.author: King Midas

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Best desktop speakers I've ever owned. Great sound and the built quality is top notch. Only one thing I found odd is the adapter is pretty big, kinda like a laptop adaptor. Everything else worked fine out of the box. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: G. Heath

customer_reviews.title: Good. Not great.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are very stylish and well put-together. They were easy to set-up. The sound was good but not great. I did not keep them for more than a day because they did not sound as full as the Bose Companion 20s that I heard at the Apple Store. It seemed like the sweet spot of the sound field was very narrow with the LES speakers and didn't sound as good throughout the room like the Bose speakers. This may have been less of a problem after they had broken in but I definitely think the Bose speakers sound better.
customer_reviews.author: Joel G Hashimoto

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work right out of the box. . .
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of not hooking these up when I got them. They sat, unopened, in their box in office for a year. When I unboxed them and plugged it all in, no power. I called Audyssey and they said there was nothing they could do as it had been too long since I purchased them. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: No audio upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: I had to ship them back. Double checked everything... Green light, chord plugged in...zero audio. Faulty unit, VERY frustrating. I hope amazon ships me another pair, and I hope they work this time!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Hacke

product_meta.title: Audyssey Lower East Side Media Speaker (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: You'll like the way the Lower East Side Media Speakers look on your desktop, but you will love the way they sound. With Audyssey Smart Speaker technology, the Lower East Side Media Speakers let you hear every musical detail: deep bass, warm mids and clear highs. Turn it up and you'll be blown away by the distortion-free, powerful and precise sound. That's the flawless audio quality that you've come to expect from Audyssey.
feature_bullets: As the first speaker of its kind with both 3.5 mm line and digital optical audio inputs..
The Lower East Side Media Speakers connects to all your electronics.
Use them with just about any playback device: computers, Apple TV, Blu-ray players, iPhone models or MP3 player.
Wherever you want your movies and music to sound better, just add the Lower East Side Speakers.
Small speakers that can't produce bass, speaker cabinets that make noise, distortion,
Or even poor sound quality at low volumes are all problems that are solved by Audyssey Smart Speaker technology.
The Lower East Side Media Speakers use Audyssey Smart Speaker digital technology to provide flawless sound for your computer and media center.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars90 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
